title: JavaJDK - Q0001
text: [Java Basics - JDK] What does JDK stand for?
explanation: JDK stands for Java Development Kit.

title: JavaJDK - Q0002
text: [Java Basics - JDK] What is the main purpose of the JDK?

options.text: To develop and compile Java programs

explanation: The JDK provides tools to develop and compile Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0003
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following components are included in the JDK?
explanation: The JDK includes the JRE, compiler, and other development tools.

title: JavaJDK - Q0004
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following tools is used to compile Java source code?
explanation: The 'javac' tool compiles Java source code into bytecode.

title: JavaJDK - Q0005
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following tools is used to run compiled Java programs?
explanation: The 'java' command runs compiled Java bytecode using the JVM.

title: JavaJDK - Q0006
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following tools is used to generate API documentation?
explanation: The 'javadoc' tool generates API documentation from source code comments.

title: JavaJDK - Q0007
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following tools is used to package Java classes into a JAR file?
explanation: The 'jar' tool packages compiled Java classes into a JAR file.

title: JavaJDK - Q0008
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is NOT part of the JDK?
explanation: The JDK does not include a database engine.

title: JavaJDK - Q0009
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK?

options.text: It includes tools for developing Java applications
It is used for debugging non-Java code
It is used for database management

explanation: The JDK includes tools for developing, compiling, and debugging Java applications.

title: JavaJDK - Q0010
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the relationship between JDK, JRE, and JVM?

options.text: JDK contains JRE, and JRE contains JVM
JRE contains JDK, and JDK contains JVM
JVM contains JRE, and JRE contains JDK
They are independent of each other

explanation: The JDK contains the JRE, which in turn contains the JVM.

title: JavaJDK - Q0011
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's bin directory?

options.text: It contains executable tools like javac and java

explanation: The bin directory contains executable tools like javac, java, and jar.

title: JavaJDK - Q0012
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's lib directory?
explanation: The lib directory contains core Java libraries required for development.

title: JavaJDK - Q0013
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's include directory?

options.text: It contains header files for native code integration

explanation: The include directory contains header files for native code integration using JNI.

title: JavaJDK - Q0014
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's demo directory?
explanation: The demo directory contains sample Java programs for learning and testing.

title: JavaJDK - Q0015
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's development tools?

options.text: They include javac, jar, and javadoc

explanation: The JDK includes development tools like javac, jar, and javadoc.

title: JavaJDK - Q0016
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's role in Java development?

options.text: It provides tools to develop, compile, and debug Java programs

explanation: The JDK provides tools to develop, compile, and debug Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0017
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's version command?
explanation: The javac -version command displays the JDK version.

title: JavaJDK - Q0018
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's environment variables?

options.text: JAVA_HOME points to the JDK installation directory
PATH points to the JDK's bin directory

explanation: JAVA_HOME points to the JDK directory, and PATH includes the JDK's bin directory.

title: JavaJDK - Q0019
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's compatibility?

options.text: A newer JDK can compile code for older Java versions
An older JDK can compile code for newer Java versions
JDK versions are not backward compatible
JDK versions are not forward compatible

explanation: A newer JDK can compile code for older Java versions using the -source and -target options.

title: JavaJDK - Q0020
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following best describes the JDK?

options.text: A software package used to develop Java applications
A runtime environment for executing Java programs
A text editor for Java files

explanation: The JDK is a software package used to develop Java applications.

title: JavaJDK - Q0021
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's relationship with the JRE?
explanation: The JDK includes the JRE, which provides the runtime environment for Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0022
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's compiler?

options.text: It converts Java source code into bytecode
It converts bytecode into machine code

explanation: The JDK compiler (javac) converts Java source code into bytecode.

title: JavaJDK - Q0023
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's debugger?

options.text: It is used to debug Java programs
It is used to compile Java programs
It is used to run Java programs
It is used to package Java programs

explanation: The JDK includes a debugger (jdb) to debug Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0024
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jar tool?

options.text: It packages Java classes into JAR files

explanation: The jar tool packages compiled Java classes into JAR files.

title: JavaJDK - Q0025
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jlink tool?
explanation: The jlink tool creates custom runtime images containing only required modules.

title: JavaJDK - Q0026
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jdeps tool?
explanation: The jdeps tool analyzes class and package dependencies in Java applications.

title: JavaJDK - Q0027
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jshell tool?

options.text: It provides an interactive REPL for Java

explanation: The jshell tool provides an interactive REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) for Java.

title: JavaJDK - Q0028
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jmod tool?

options.text: It creates and manages Java module files

explanation: The jmod tool creates and manages Java module files (.jmod).

title: JavaJDK - Q0029
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jmap tool?

options.text: It prints memory maps of Java processes

explanation: The jmap tool prints memory maps and heap details of Java processes.

title: JavaJDK - Q0030
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jstat tool?
explanation: The jstat tool monitors JVM performance statistics.

title: JavaJDK - Q0031
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jconsole tool?

options.text: It provides a GUI for monitoring JVM performance

explanation: The jconsole tool provides a GUI for monitoring JVM performance and memory usage.

title: JavaJDK - Q0032
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jps tool?
explanation: The jps tool lists all running Java processes on the system.

title: JavaJDK - Q0033
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jstack tool?

options.text: It prints stack traces of Java threads

explanation: The jstack tool prints stack traces of Java threads for debugging.

title: JavaJDK - Q0034
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jinfo tool?

options.text: It displays configuration information for Java processes

explanation: The jinfo tool displays configuration information for running Java processes.

title: JavaJDK - Q0035
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jhat tool?
explanation: The jhat tool analyzes heap dumps generated by the JVM.

title: JavaJDK - Q0036
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jcmd tool?

options.text: It sends diagnostic commands to Java processes

explanation: The jcmd tool sends diagnostic commands to running Java processes.

title: JavaJDK - Q0037
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jvisualvm tool?

options.text: It provides a GUI for monitoring and profiling Java applications

explanation: The jvisualvm tool provides a GUI for monitoring and profiling Java applications.

title: JavaJDK - Q0038
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's javap tool?
explanation: The javap tool disassembles Java class files to view bytecode.

title: JavaJDK - Q0039
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's javadoc tool?

options.text: It generates HTML documentation from source code comments

explanation: The javadoc tool generates HTML documentation from Java source code comments.

title: JavaJDK - Q0040
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's javah tool (deprecated)?

options.text: It generated C header files for native methods

explanation: The javah tool (deprecated) generated C header files for native methods.

title: JavaJDK - Q0041
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jpackage tool?

options.text: It packages Java applications into native installers

explanation: The jpackage tool packages Java applications into native installers.

title: JavaJDK - Q0042
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jfr tool?

options.text: It records flight recordings for performance analysis

explanation: The jfr tool records flight recordings for performance analysis.

title: JavaJDK - Q0043
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jstatd tool?
explanation: The jstatd tool monitors JVM statistics remotely.

title: JavaJDK - Q0044
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's jlink tool?
explanation: The jlink tool creates custom runtime images containing only required modules.

title: JavaJDK - Q0045
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's javac tool?

options.text: It compiles Java source code into bytecode

explanation: The javac tool compiles Java source code into bytecode.

title: JavaJDK - Q0046
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's role in Java development?

options.text: It provides all tools required for Java development

explanation: The JDK provides all tools required for Java development, including compilation and debugging.

title: JavaJDK - Q0047
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's version compatibility?

options.text: A newer JDK can compile code for older Java versions
An older JDK can compile code for newer Java versions
JDK versions are not backward compatible
JDK versions are not forward compatible

explanation: A newer JDK can compile code for older Java versions using the -source and -target options.

title: JavaJDK - Q0048
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's role in Java architecture?

options.text: It provides tools for developing and compiling Java programs

explanation: The JDK provides tools for developing and compiling Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0049
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following is true about the JDK's role in Java execution?

options.text: It includes the JRE to run compiled Java programs

explanation: The JDK includes the JRE, which allows running compiled Java programs.

title: JavaJDK - Q0050
text: [Java Basics - JDK] Which of the following best describes the JDK?

options.text: A complete software package for developing, compiling, and running Java programs
A runtime environment for executing Java programs only
A debugger for Java programs only
A text editor for Java files

explanation: The JDK is a complete software package for developing, compiling, and running Java programs.
